bibl.title: Local Epics and Epic Cycles: the Anomalous Case of a Submerged Genre.
bibl.note: The 'submersion' of epic narrations on Heracles. - Epic narratives with local concerns: fated for submersion? - Some hypotheses on likely factors of emergence and submersion. - P. 89: Overview of 'Submerged' Epic Poetry [see III: Instances of lost epics from papyri].

bibl.title: Submerged Literature in Ancient Greek Culture. [Volume 1.] An Introduction.

bibl.seg: Laura Lulli, Local Epics and Epic Cycles: the Anomalous Case of a Submerged Genre.
Giulio Colesanti & Manuela Giordano (edd.), Submerged Literature in Ancient Greek Culture. [Volume 1.] An Introduction (Berlin - Boston, 2014) pp. 76-89, 1 tabl.

The 'submersion' of epic narrations on Heracles. - Epic narratives with local concerns: fated for submersion? - Some hypotheses on likely factors of emergence and submersion. - P. 89: Overview of 'Submerged' Epic Poetry [see III: Instances of lost epics from papyri].
